PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines module¶

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.Erase_custom_fields()[source]¶

Resets the .costum field of all the Nodes on which we have iterated here. Usefull to perform after node set or node connectivity were modfied. Unlike the method in the Matrix_retrieval cluster, this method is very time-consuming, since it iterates on all the elements of all the classes susceptible to have the costum field.

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.Look_up_Annot_Node(p_load, p_type='')[source]¶

Looks up nodes accessible via the annotation nodes with a given annotation and given annotation type. The lookup strict match, but case-insensitive.

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.Look_up_by_ID_for_a_set(Domain, ID_set)[source]¶

Looks up nodes by legacy IDs from an ID_set list and prints their access url. The lookup is a case-sensitive strict match.

Parameters:
  • Domain – Node type of the form of DatabaseGraph.Object
  • Domain – Node type of the form of DatabaseGraph.Object
  • ID_set – list of requested legacy ID
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.count_items(Domain)[source]¶

Stupid counter that gets the number of items in a given domain

Warning:this method is highly underoptimal
Parameters:Domain – Domain of the DatabaseGraph.Object whose objects we are going to count
Returns:number of objects in the domain
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.expand_from_seed(Seed_Node_ID, edge_filter, main_connex_only)[source]¶
Recovers all the nodes accessible in one jump from a seed_node with a given database ID by jumping only via the relations
of type specified in the edge_filter
Parameters:
  • Seed_Node_ID – the database ID of the initial node from which we are observing accessibility
  • edge_filter – the list of relation types for which the jumps are authorised
Returns:

List of found nodes database ID, number of found nodes
Return type:

2- tuple
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.lookup_by_ID(Domain, req)[source]¶

Looks up a node by legacy ID and prints it’s access url. The lookup is a case-sensitive strict match.

Parameters:
  • Domain – Node type of the form of DatabaseGraph.Object
  • req – requested legacy ID
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.reaction_participant_getter(Reaction, main_connex_only)[source]¶

Recovers all the participants of the reaction

Parameters:
  • Reaction – Reaction node for which we are willing to get the participants
  • main_connex_only (bool) – If set to true, will only pull elements from the reaction that are in the main connex_set
Returns:

List of found nodes, number of found nodes
Return type:

2- tuple
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.recompute_forbidden_IDs(Node_Type_Dict)[source]¶

Recomputes the list of nodes that contain overloaded terms that would bring too close together the reactions that are normally not, just because of participation of ultra-aboundant elements, such as H2O, H+ or ATP

Parameters:Node_Type_List – Dictionary mapping the names of entities to their corresponding bulbs classes
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.recover_UP_chars(UP_Nodes, UP_are_IDs)[source]¶
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.run_through(node_generator)[source]¶

Supporting function. Gets the nodes that are referenced by the annot_nodes in the generator

Parameters:node_generator – iterator over annot_nodes
Returns:the list of object nodes accessible from this set of annot_nodes
Raises Warning:if an annotation node is not bound to a real node. This might happen if some object nodes were manually deleted, but not their annotation nodes. Tu curb this a full database reload is required
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.DB_IO_Routines.unwrap_DB_ID(node_generator)[source]¶

Supporting function. Gets the nodes that are referenced by the annot_nodes in the generator

Parameters:node_generator – iterator over annot_nodes
Returns:the DB_IDs list of object nodes accessible from this set of annot_nodes
Raises Warning:if an annotation node is not bound to a real node. This might happen if some object nodes were manually deleted, but not their annotation nodes. Tu curb this a full database reload is required
